cyclone.name: ROSA
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi WNW of Punta Eugenia, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north-northeast across the Baja California peninsula tonight, then into the northern Gulf of California and the Desert Southwest Tuesday–Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Northern Baja California peninsula near or just north of Punta Eugenia

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Baja California from Bahia de los Angeles to San Felipe (T.S. Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: West coast of Baja California from Punta Abreojos to Cabo San Quintin (T.S. Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Most of the Baja California coast, northern Gulf of California, northwest Sonora, southern California for high surf
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty winds 25–35 mph possible Tuesday as Rosa’s remnants pass east of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: High surf and dangerous rip currents through Tuesday; no significant surge in the bay expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rainfall possible Tuesday–early Wednesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Heavy surf and rip currents impacting port approaches and pilot boarding areas
